Minimum Wage vs. Inflation and the Cost of Living

Over the last century of American history the cost of living has drastically changed. From the Roaring 20's and the Great Depression, through the 2008 Recession and currently an International pandemic, the US economy has been through hills and valleys. However, has the minimum wage been able to keep up with the roller coaster economy? Though the answer may be more obvious to some versus others, that is what we set out to discover.
